newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Visa 1996 Asia-Pacific credit card use hits record.
newsitem.headline: Visa 1996 Asia-Pacific credit card use hits record.

text.p: Credit card operator Visa International said on Thursday card sales in the Asia-Pacific region soared 29 percent to US$171.8 billion in 1996, a record.
Strong growth in new cards issued and a rise in card sales volume boosted the figures, Visa said in a statement.
Card sales volume rose 34 percent in Japan, 50 percent in Taiwan, 39 percent in Malaysia and 32 percent in Australia over 1995.
The emerging card markets of India and Pakistan also showed healthy growth of 65 percent and 51 percent respectively.
China card sales volume was up 17 percent to US$4.8 billion. Chinese commercial banking transactions via Visa of US$54.5 billion were not included in the figures.
The number of Visa-branded cards issued also hit a new high in 1996, passing 100 million units for the first time to end the year at 101.1 million cards in circulation, up 18 percent year on year.
